text: the swimmer Michael Phelps won his
second gold medal today but that wasn't
really the story coming out of the Water
Cube if it's possible to upstage the man
chasing Mark Spitz Jason Lezak managed
it his anchor leg on the US men's four
by 100 freestyle relay was brilliant
Eamonn Sullivan of Australia broke
quickly out of the gate
Sullivan clocked a forty seven point two
for Garrett Webber Gale gave the
Americans hope and the lead with his
split of 40 7.02 Colin Jones split a
47.65 and relinquished the lead but he
couldn't really blame himself his French
counterpart Fredrik Bousquet swam a
blistering 4663
that was the fastest all-time split but
not for long Lee Zack hit the water
trailing Alain Bernard by half a second
the Americans were lucky in Lezak they
had their Mariano Rivera a
tough-as-nails closer dragging off
Bernard Lee Zack made up ground but with
25 meters remaining it appeared he was
going to run out of pool
he saved precious time at the finish by
hitting the wall in perfect stride eight
hundredths of a second was all that
separated the teams as the US squad won
the gold and shattered the day old world
record beating it by four seconds
Phelps when he saw the one on the
scoreboard raised his arms and let out a
primal scream that I'm sure was heard
all the way back in Baltimore his
hometown his pursuit of Spitz lives on
with a huge assist from Lee Zack this is
Karin Krauss from the New York Times
reporting from Beijing
